review: I have been to Red Robin twice since I moved here about a week and a half ago. I also ate here last summer. This is your typical chain so the food is always gonna be the same 98% of the time. Their SWEET POTATO FRIES are the bomb, so much better than your average fries. The service is good for the most part, I will admit that sometimes they keep you waiting on stuff, like they did our ticket for a good 10 minutes. Make sure you tell them if you have a time limit. Their bathrooms are clean and I havent found much reason to complain.
Food & service was good today. But no military discount. So yet another restaurant outside the gate glad to take our money but not give anything back.

Every time I go, I'm satisfied. The waiters and waitresses are almost always nice and fast. If you don't know what to get the clucks and fries are good with the crunchy chicken strips and the hot fries. It is usually crowded as it is a chain restaurant and it can get loud at times but the atmosphere is still friendly. Sometimes the service is slow and they can forget about you or forgot your extra fries but that's because of the busy times. I always think this is a good place to go.

10/14/12: Ok the seating is crazy! They can not put anymore tables in this joint! I feel like I'm visiting some 3rd world  country cafe.  Today the food took about 40 minutes to arrive but everything was cold, I'm disappointed. You know it sucks when the ketchup is warmer than the french fries.   Here's a tip: there is a Firetap restaurant across the street go there before here. That's free from me to you.   PS- server Robert is a good at his profession.

Good burgers. Go well with an Alaskan Amber. Only had 1 bad experience in 2 yrs worth of visits. It's your standard Big-ass burger joint. Stick to the classics and ask for some of the bottomless fries as an appetizer.

You can never go wrong with the Bleu Ribbon burger or the Avo-Cobb-O salad. Simple review for great food and okay service depending on the day. They do forget sometimes, but it was just for lemon for my water, which she bought be a lot afterwards. Not the end of days because of that.  And did a guy just give this place 3 stars because they don't have a military discount? Seriously? There are a bunch of other places that don't give one. How about you go to Fridays to get your measly 5% off your meal? You lowered their rating because they didn't give you, what, $1.00 off your check? We appreciate you for signing a contract saying that you will protect the country...we show it by you having BAH, along with your pay that us taxpayers are giving you (where did you think the government get their money from?) but you down an establishment because you couldn't get back the dollar that we gave you in the first place? Whatever. Just looked at his other reviews and he's a pretty bad reviewer. One place got two stars because they stopped serving sweet tea smh... Anyway go to red robin. No military discounts but great food and service.
Had the Cobb Salad, which was great.  But it was $15 a plate for lunch, with no lunch specials.  Service was good.  Will definitely go back, just wish it was cheaper, especially for lunch.

The minute you walk in you get the sense of a Chuck E Cheese atmosphere that lingers in the air. Private conversations do not exist as the tables are so close to each other. The food is very commercial and the service is just the same (not bad, but most defiantly NOT magnificent). The drinks are watered down and pricy. If you like feeling like cattle who can only eat blah food and drink tasteless beverages, then be my guess.

Decent food, but not really what I was expecting.  No pastas for lunch, not enough cheese on the nachos, chicken on the nachos was very bland and not tex-mex style where it is cooked almost like carnitas.  Great black beans on the nachos, though they could use more cilantro (there was only a tiny sprig for decoration).  I had the tundra burger (caribou and bison) and it was great!  My husband had the HOT serrano burger and he liked it too.  Maybe next time we'll try the pizza as the pepperoni looked very classic and cheesy..

The burgers are good as usual, but the chicken and salads aren't as flavorful, since the burgers are their specialty. Service was bad that day. I understand it was around dinnertime, but servers should at least be around to ask how well things are going, or even be in the area. We asked for help from other servers to get more fries and get the bill. I typically like going to Red Robin, but service was nearly non-existent. If I go back, I'll give the Dimond Red Robin a try... after a while perhaps.

We used to come here before kids and we come here now with kids and they just have a really good burger. I used to get the Banzai burger all the time but now the Blue Ribbon burger is my favorite. Fries are good and service ranges from OK to Good. The volume in there is loud. So without kids we didn't care about kids around because overall it was loud enough to drown things out. Now with kids it is nice if occasionally they get loud it isn't a big deal (anything beyond something really quick my kids are out of there not tolerated behavior in public). Negatives: At times slow servers - we usually counter this with pre-requesting items like can you give us the bill when we get the food. Other negative is sometimes other people bring the food and it is like they aren't authorized to get you anything else like the bbq sauce you had requested. Also we are typically not asked about getting more fries. Not a big deal as we would say no but it is part of their selling point. Will definately be back

This Tikahtnu location is fantastic, but I'd give the Dimond location negative stars if I could!! There is such a huge difference in the staff, the food, the atmosphere, etc. Every restaurant has their good days and bad days, but at Red Robin in Tikahtnu, they really want you to be happy with your food! They have some of the most genuine and kind staff of any restaurant! I know several waiters and waitresses by first name and they will remember what I ordered the last time I was there, even months later!!! I know I'm always gonna be happy when I leave Red Robin!
The staff is exceptional! I always enjoy going in here. If you order a meal that comes with fries, they'll bring them while you're waiting, too.

Food is pretty good and I love me some Red Robin fries. All the times we've been in there is always a wait but I can see open seats...?? The service isn't the greatest. The servers aren't knowledgeable and I felt very rushed to leave because they gave us the check before we finished our meal and we planned on ordering more beer and dessert. So overall, the food is good just not great service.
I love their burgers, simple and delicious, exceptional service. However, it was a bit too noisy for me. I loved their fries, really good.  I wish the burger was served hot though.

I stopped going to RR years ago because their burgers were always salty/overcooked and there was nothing new on the menu. My partner was craving a burger yesterday and I reluctantly acquiesced  to splitting one at RR. To my delight, they have come out with the "signature" burger series and we tried the DGB. It was delicious! This time they cooked it to perfection, just as requested, a little pink in the middle. Juicy, fresh, and hot - hit the spot.  I think they can improve upon the burger by toasting the ciabatta bun, just my opinion. We upgraded to the sweet potato fries and our server, Brian, promptly gave us a refill upon seeing we were getting low. We went early on a Thursday evening, when it was not so crowded/noisy - about 5:30pm. That may have contributed to the prompt service and hot food. I am deducting a star because I think $14.29 is a bit steep for a burger, so not such a good value, even in Alaska. RR knows they will get  customers so they can charge high prices.

Very disappointing visit yesterday. Restaurant was busy and we were told there would be a 15-20 minute wait. Not a problem but then this happened... When our name was called another party cut line, lied about their name and even thought two of three hostesses doing the seating knew this was wrong. Unbelievably they still were given our table! Their lie allowed them to cut in front of us and two other parties on the waiting list ahead if them. When we informed the hostess of what happened the girl taking names blamed the girl doing the seating who in turn blamed the third hostess. When we asked the manager about the mixup. She apologized but initially did nothing.  Instead she had the girl who sat the line cutting party ask them to get up and they being the very rude people they were refused to get up.  Adding to that their server rushed to their table even though it was known as I said and reminded the manager 3 parties were jumped by these people. The manager went to the kitchen to hide and to I assume figure out what to do. When she approached  us and we asked her what her plan was to fix the situation. She said they had the entire staff looking for a table. And it wasn't their policy to ask patrons to leave tables or the restaurant.   When we complained further another manager flipped two free appetizer coupons at us and also said free drinks. In all honesty the line jumper should have been kicked out and our meal should have been free.  (And no I never look for a situation to complain to get a free meal) I understand the manager's hands were somewhat  tied. However making a hostess do your dirty work and then make excuses is not acceptable. When finally seated the waitress was phenomenal! She suggested the most expensive appetizers and drinks for our trouble. At the end  the manager brought two pieces of cheesecake.   Food was passable but the initial incident probably jaded our opinions.  I would suggest if you really want Red Robin go to the Dimond location, never had an issue there.

We were craving burgers so it was off to Red Robin for dinner. They have a new computer screen thingy at the table that lets you request your server, pay your check, order drinks, appetizers and desserts. You can also play games on it for $1.99 flat fee. It was kind of neat- the husband ordered a bottomless root beer float partway through our meal.  Our server was amazing. She kept the root beer floats coming and encouraged us to share! Are we still in Alaska??? I also noticed that if I didn't want bottomless fries, I could get a salad, cole slaw, steamed veggies, fruit or something else I can't remember for NO CHARGE! And they were also bottomless. She was also very honest when we asked which burger she recommended: the Fiery Ghost burger or the D.G.B. She said the D.G.B. cost more and didn't come with cheese and she thought the Fiery Ghost to be a better bet. Wait. Was this a server in Alaska not trying to upsell every second?? This is a place that would have my business again and again. Our burgers were fantastic and my freckled lemonade always full. We didn't use the screen to play any games (dinner time is family time, no screens allowed) but I like the option to use it, especially dining solo. I would almost venture a guess and say this may have been the best sit-down restaurant experience we've experienced since living here. Amazing service? Check. Great food? Check. No scamming for up charges? Check. Actually, no check just yet. We will stay for dessert.
Took the family here that was up for vacation and the food was great. Our server was Emil and he did an excellent job.

Great place to hangout and not worry about being noisy!  I really enjoy their burgers. They are nice sized, and the restaurant is really clean.  They offer more than burgers, so you can still visit with a group and not worry that the menu is one sided!
Never again.Food was almost cold.Too salty and just not good.We were asked to pay while we were still eating.Not a pleasant lunch experience at all.
Where has this place been all of my life? Best gourmet burger I have ever eaten. Service is top notch and did I mention how good the food is? Love the place and eat there 1 to 2 times a week.

The only reason this place even gets three stars is because the food is good. I would have to give them a one or two stars for everything else. The service is hit and miss as with any restaurant. They have those kiosks that allow you to pay/order from the table which is great but it causes the customer service to lack. Sometimes you're lucky if you see your server after you get your food; let's hope you didn't want anything else, because you're probably not going to get it. Don't even get me started on the cleanliness of this place, it's horrible. I understand they get busy sometimes, so you can't get to something right away, but the bathrooms are almost always trashed and the way they clean their tables is awful. I'm sorry, but I don't want your shoes all over my seat unless you're going to wipe it off. I mean come on it only takes a few seconds to clean the tables/booths properly trust me, people will wait.

All I can say is Yum!!! My burger was tasty and well done  just like I wanted. My bun was warm and soft and perfect and shortly after taking a bite 80s  music amazingness was playing in the background.  All that was missing was fireworks. Dinner was perfect  this evening. Unfortunately  there was no room for dessert.

Will not be giving this place a third chance. My husband and I went about two  months ago and walked away thinking it was "Ok." Having been to many Red Robins back home in CO, I expected much much more!  Last night we went back to give it another shot and it was awful!! Waited about ten minutes before we even saw our server and another couple of minutes later before she actually came over to us. Our drinks, soft drinks and water, took another ten minutes to get. Our food order was the 1/2 order of the nachos which were alright and we each got a burger for our entree. My husband got the Whiskey BBQ burger and he said it was just alright and I got the mushroom burger and it was INEDIBLE! Completely overdone, bun was dry, piled high with was looked like canned mushrooms with absolutely no seasoning. I added the Red Robin seasoning to add a bit of flavor but I ultimately left most everything on my plate untouched. My husband tried it and agreed that it was terrible. He asked for a refill on his drink when the appetizer plate was picked up (before our burgers showed up) but he never received it. We paid at the table machine and couldn't have gotten out of there fast enough!  No third chance will be given!!

I am currently eating here with my boyfriend. We just got done eating our meals, and I saw this one SA (server assistant) using the same rag to dust off the lights, wipe off the tables and the salt n pepper and the chairs... Using the same rag.. This is a great place to eat but after just watching the SA do this, i don't think ill come back again
Good food, great service. I can't complain. It's a chain, and while they lack originality, they check off every other box with extreme efficiency. Never had a bad server, drink, or dish.

For a chain I've always loved red robin! We go here a crap ton. I've been here for business meetings, dates, pleasure, girls nights, birthdays and family nights. The fries are my favorite and I always get the BLTA with no bacon. It's SO good. I'm a little disappointed they've taken off the BBQ chicken salad though. It was by far the best. They have a fun little drink selection, open bar and bar seating, and the service is usually pretty good here. I like that everything is electronic but sometimes it takes away from the actual service aspect of it. Seems like it's always a different person who brings us each part of the order; drinks, appetizers, entrées and checking up on us rarely after. Onion ring tower is pretty delicious, and I like their campfire sauce.
Different from when I was a kid, definitely way better management and cooks. Southwest chicken salad was amazing. Fast in clean. I was literally shocked at how good the service was. -Candace
I love Red Robin's food, but I always order it to go because the restaurant is busy and very loud.

I came in last night  because a friend and I wanted to get a quick bite before a movie at the Tik. We got sat fairly quickly, and someone came to take our drink order. It took a bit before we had our dinner order taken, but that was okay because it gave me a minute to take in all the changes Red Robin had morphed through. Now, there is a little computer on the table so you can order apps, call your server, and play games for a small fee. The menus are these little books instead of one large poster sized menu. When you check out with a credit card you pay the table machine instead of the server, and it even helps you add tip to your bill if adding isn't your strong suit.  I ordered a Keep It Simple with a vegan burger that came in a different set up. Unfortunately the patty was not cooked well and the accompaniments were lacking. My friend ordered a signature burger that came on a ciabatta roll, and he said it was okay, but not as good as some of the ole standbys. We had a good time, and service was decent. The best part was that I left my cell phone and came back 20 minutes later and Brian (not our server) noticed it and handed it to a manager to hold for safekeeping. That was awesome. There are so many horror stories on people losing cell phones because of shady people and I was super stoked to get mine back. Thanks for being awesome, Brian M.
LOVE. this red robin Latin has always been in top of its game. Never a long wait for anything, and the wait staff is so accommodating.  I

Friendly servers/great service. They make it comfortable for me and my little family, appetizers come in on time, food is served warm/hot, but have had few times where my food was cold :( still..good selection for kiddos(they love the spaghetti & freckled lemonade) always coming in for the D'oh Rings! So good. Love the burgers, more filling than you think.  Tip to diners-tip your waiter/waitresses with cash!(tax cut off tip w/ card payment)
Aweful aweful burger, cold fries, still cold fries when complained.  Server tried to accomodate.  Don't visit and expect much. 5 hours later food poisoning sets in. Oh goody.

Terrible I have been to this place three times exclusively for work related functions (going aways, etc) and I will never go back.  Service is terrible, with larger groups you pay and put your order into some stupid computer thing that's passed around and then if it doesn't work the servers seem to have an attitude about it.  I used to like Red Robbin's onions rings when I had them at their other locations in the lower 48 but these are mediocre at best.  Their "gourmet" burgers are only a step up from the mcdonalds next door... on a good day and drowned with condiments.  Every time I went I ended up with abdominal cramps and running to the restroom.  I think the food is loaded with preservatives.  Never again...

Good burgers, solid fries, a casual dining atmosphere. I've gotten the limited time genisys burger both times and it's really solid. It's kind of funny, I bet the burger has made more than the movie. The beer selection is pretty lacking.

I go here a bit more than is like to admit, but certain staff members are more then attentive and considerate taking the time to say hello when they recognize us. The food is what you would expect from a national chain restaurant= consistent. Always quick and usually chipper, this place is always on our last minute dine out list.
For a chain burger joint this place is really great. It can be packed at lunch time being right off of the military post yet we have always had good, if not great, service.

Five stars for giving all veterans a meal on Veterans Day! Last year I went to Applebee's, this year Red Robin. The place was mobbed, but I didn't mind waiting in the company of fellow warriors and their families. A tip of the hat to you Red Robin!

Not the best red robin I've been too! They were kinda busy which is fine I'm patient my husband , daughter and I waited to be seated our server got our orders ...... 15mins went by okay no worries since it was a busy night! 10mins later our food arrive our burgers were cold as if they had just been sitting in the kitchen waiting to be brought out our server didn't even bring the food to us someone else did...... Not to mention we didn't even complain we just paid and left and won't be returning back to this location !! Only giving them 2stars because our margaritas were awesome!!

Just went to McD's because 25 minutes later, we still didn't have a water, or an order. Server guy was slammed, yes. But, also very disorganized. Spoke to us once and then wandered about with refills and the like. You gotta turn those tables kid, cause that's money in your bank. Sure wanted those 4 burgers and a tower of onions tonight. Maybe it's this side of town? More often than not, RR food is pretty solid. It sure seems like we have more lame service there than anywhere else, though. I can't count how many times over the past many years, we've said... Haha. "Not going back there."  But we miss the onion rings and bottomless fries. Sadness.
My first time to a Red Robin. The atmosphere is great as well as the service. The burgers are good.

Went here for for a birthday tonight & server TK was awesome! Very attentive and respectful.  Had the new nacho crunch tavern double burger, it was delicious!      I have not had 1 bad visit here.  Thank you again!

I have been back two times since my last review.   I have been pleasantly surprised each time.  I added a extra star.  Everything I have ordered has been good and timely considering the amount of business they usually have.  The staff does a great job and their product shows it.

My husband and i just visited this location for an early supper and had a server named Evan. He was the best!!! His personality was so upbeat and positive! He had a great vibe that it flowed off onto us. We have always received great service from this location but Evan made it memorable and we will definitely be back to see him!

Their food is alright, the seafood basket, (I can't remember the real name) which consists of two fish fillets, some fried shrimp, and some fried clam strips is pretty dang impressive for a burger place. However, the three stars is due to the fact that they cannot make a decent raspberry iced tea (it's all syrup that isn't stirred in, just sitting at the bottom of a glass of non-sweetened tea). And a lot of the time their customer service isn't all that great unfortunately. If they could just fix those two things, I think they would be a 5-star place.
Always have to stop at red robin when we come to anchorage. Waiter was really friendly.
My first stop when I arrived in anchorage. I had the blue cheese burger with the sweet potato fries. Our waiter was great. It was late so we took our donuts to go. Oh man they were good.

I've been here several times, but today seemed a bit off. We entered the restaurant and I wasn't greeted by anyone. It was a busboy that had to give us a menu and showed us to our table. When I told him we preferred a booth, he seemed a bit upset. I figured it wasn't a problem since he must be pulling double duty, but there were many tables available. It was not busy at all for a 3pm Monday crowd. The server was nice and took our order right away. Our drinks got to us quickly as did our onion rings, which were fresh and delicious. I think it was the manager that brought us our entrees, but he seemed a bit unattentive. Maybe even somewhat rude for being the manager. The tables weren't the cleanest, the floor wasn't either, the windows were smeared, and the restroom was dirty, dark, and stinky. The cleanliness as a whole deserved a 1 star. I expect more from a food chain that we spent more than $50 (not including gratuity) for two people. One thing that surprised me was that the bartender was eating her take-out food from Carr's at the tables were paying customers eat, and the manager didn't say a word to her. As for the food, we had 2 love burgers with fries. They were luke warm and my sweet potatoes fries were toooooo salty. I understand fries are salty, but this was over the top. Even banging the salt off was insufficient. We left with a bad experience.  I have always considered Red Robin as a great place to dine. I will think twice next time.

Went back again yesterday. The location was very clean this time but the customer service was poor. Previously ordered to-go via the phone for lunch but the lady at the bar was so rude we stopped. Well yesterday decided it had been a while (6 months) and had received a email from the manager, that we would go again. Got there and order was wrong which was okay because the phone connection had been bad so figured she just did not hear me. When informed that it was wrong and would not mind waiting to have it redone the lady at the bar had a attitude. Decided to ignore it as maybe she was busy. Husband went to pay and the lady was rude to him for no reason. Thus, I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS LOCATION until the customer service can be improved. Gave a extra star because they have really improved on the cleanliness of the location.

Terrible service and canned food. Waitress was somewhere else. Food not so good. I mean I know this is red robin and not a non franchise restaurant but it was worse than others we've been at Being polite giving it a 2 star as restrooms were clean and bill was accurate

After being to many red robin locations, this is the only one that did not meet our standards. After being sat down, a waitress did not come over to us for over 15 minutes. We had already read the entire menu, chosen what we wanted to order, re-read the menu to determine if we missed something better, and anxiously tried to place our order on the tablet which we were unable to do.  When our server finally arrived, she frantically took our order and disappeared again until our entrees arrived, which meant we ate our appetizer without silverware or napkins. The appetizer that we chose, the $7.00 pretzels and beer cheese sauce was decent. We just wished that it was served with more cheese sauce. We would have asked for more, but our server was MIA.  Our burgers tasted good, but were served room temperature. The fries were good, especially the garlic herbed ones, but they were the only part of our meal that was served hot. Again, we did not see our server during the time we ate our entrees, so we finished our room temperature burgers and paid on the tablet without ever seeing our server again.  The ONLY reason I am giving 2 stars rather than 1 is that I have been to many other Red Robin locations and know that I probably had a weird, bad experience.

Horrible experience !!! Me, my husband and son came in and requested a table for 5 and was told we would have to wait 15 to 20 minutes , which was fine, no biggie. We waited and saw a couple of friends and asked if we could join them at a big table the hostess said yes which turned our 20 min wait into a five minute wait because she gave us a big booth! Awesome. So we are seated and joined with two other gentlemen and  the waitress finally comes over and (not kidding ) SCREAMS "THERE YOU GUYS ARE !!! I WAS SCARED I LOST YOU!" She added flirtatious laugh and left... okay maybe it wasn't our server than she was out our friends previous server.?? Another 15 minutes later she finally comes back over and asked what we wanted to drink. Took another 15 minutes just to get our drinks. I understand how being busy gets so no biggie. Finally our drinks arrive and so do our other two friends.took another 20 mins foe them to get drinks and our refill. Finally we get our appetizer. Which was served with THE STALEST CHIPS IVE EVER BEEN SERVED. they were so stale they were chewy and could not be broken in half. Whatever we only got a tiny cup of dip anyway ? (What's up with that we pay 9 dollars and get the bare minimum?) Finally after flagging oir waitress down 3 times she comes back with refills and new chips which are just as stale.. She flirts with the two friends again and leaves and comes back with our food 40 mins later which is barley room temperature. Absolutely disappointed as this is a close establishment to the base. But do not think we will be returning. We get better service and better food at McDonald's!

My Anchorage Red Robin Odyssey - Part 2 So Part 1 is the review of my unfortunate experience with RR on Diamond.  After walking out of that restaurant after about 2 minutes, I decided to get in my car make the drive to the Tikahtnu Shopping area where the only other RR restaurant in Anchorage is located.  And I'm glad I did. As mentioned in my other review, I'm a Seattle native and grew up on RR burgers.  Just about every other restaurant I patronized has been pretty consistent.  Unfortunately, the Diamond location doesn't seem to have fixed their issues with staffing.  But this review isn't about that location.  Here's my experience with this location: I walked in and being alone, I immediately proceeded to the bar.  There were only a few tables available, but all were clean.  I grabbed a seat at one of the tall tables and within 2 minutes someone was bringing me silverware, a menu and asking me if I'd like something to drink.  "Why, yes I would!  A Hefeweizen please!"  A few minutes later my waiter, Shane, appears and takes my order.  Everyone was very friendly.  My burger arrives in about 20 minutes.  Despite it taking me all of about 5 minutes to wolf it down, two different people came by to ask me if it was tasting alright...which, it turns out, it did.  My Banzai Burger was freaking AMAZING...as usual. I was worried that the only other RR in town might also let me down, but it didn't.  Crisis averted.  As I will be moving up to Anchorage soon, it's really nice to know that the burgers I grew up on are still available...with great service. This location is well staffed with friendly, helpful people.  The restaurant is new and clean.  Simply put, it easily lives up to what I expect from a RR franchise.  I'm not sure yet where I'll be living in Anchorage, but regardless, I will be making the drive to patronize this location. Thanks, Shane, for the awesome service!

Just left.  After we were seated at a wobbly table we waited over 20 minutes for our food.  We  watched a booth of two people arrive after us and rrceived their at least 10 minutes before us.  They did not bring the right order.  When our burgers finally arrived they were  not hot at best warm.  No extra fries were offered.  But when it came time to pay (the tip) the waitress was tripping over herself to be nice.  Overall a poor dinner.

Red Robin, much like Texas Roadhouse is always delicious and CONSISTENT; from Texas to Alaska, & everywhere in between, we always seem to gravitate towards Red Robin because we know we will always get quality burgers and prompt service.  This experience has set the bar unimaginably higher for Red Robin because of the spectacular service received by "TK".  Great, personable server that makes Red Robin that much better.  We had our usual whiskey river burger w/ sweet potato fries & blue cheese burger that never disappoint.(Both Red Robin signature burgers) **PRO TIP** Add an extra beef patty on the side for only $1.99 if you're extra hungry or like us, want a treat for the pups upon our comatose return home. Always delicious Red Robin!

The wife and I stopped by after not eating at a Red Robin for about 4 years due to absolutely terrible service.  It looked like the trend would continue with the server we got.  After we complained about not getting our thai dipping sauce (which is very good) we got a new server.  Rick saved the trip.  He was great.  Thanks to him we will come back.

Love this restaurant in the states but cannot stand any of the stores in Alaska. The service is consistently terrible. Every time we eat here we have to wait 10 minutes just to order a drink and another 20 to get a food order in.

I hate to admit it. But I love red Robbin 70% of the time. It was the only real chain restaurant. From the 80's. To the newer franchises. They had great customer service. And never even asked if you wanted more fries. Then they changed. As competition offered better deals. But they made a serious mistake. They shrunk portions. Burgers and fries. And thought simple science. Make the customer wait for another small portion of ' bottomless steak fries". consumer will be full. And not want to stick around. And they shrunk the portion of the burgers as well. There only concern now? How do you make assholes who steal their special seasonings pay. That's sad that people do that. But I don't. Yet I'm paying for somebody else's lack of morals. Order something to go? You will get a half portion of a half portion.

Man if only the service could be faster during the lunch rush. The fry refill takes forever. The food is good it just takes forever to order, receive your food, get change for the check, etc. The waiting staff is nice just seems to be a bottleneck effect when you have to receive your order
Great service. Didn't have to wait and order came out pretty quick. TK was very nice and accommodating. Have no complaints. Food was amazing. Will definitely be back.

Wow.  I have come here literally hundreds of times in the last 20 years, so I know what to expect, service wise and good wise.  I asked for extra fries when we sat down, an hour later - nope.  Our server finally hit the table at 14 minutes seated, then left , back 12 minutes later so we could order - we got served cold food, no water, not even a chance for refills and I don't know if they were short staffed (the place was quite literally HALF full), but the only person with any sense of urgency seemed to be the bartender.  I brought my one year old in straight out of daycare (about 445/5) and asked for milk, quickly please as I was totally out and he was pissed. Roughly half an hour later we got it. (I was watching the bar. The bar was being watched by the manager, then the bartender would come back and print out 10-12 tickets and fill orders).  This was a REALLY bad experience. For me and my sons. Ridiculous.

We had a great time here at Red Robin having a few drinks and of course tasty food. Alysha is the bar tender and is absolutely awesome and treated us great! Will be back the staff makes the experience!!

The service here was excellent, and our server, Tia, was fantastic. She was very personable, kept up with our orders, and was honest about what food was worth ordering. The food was pretty good, and there was plenty of it.

This is one of favorite spots to grab a mushroom burger and endless fries for a decent price. I haven't had a bad experience and I've been going to this location since they first opened. Wonderful service as well. The servers are great! Shane was our server tonight, and he was very attentive!
